empty.title: No favorites yet
empty.desc: You haven't added any favorites yet.
empty.action: Click the heart icon on any prompt to save it here.

registration.title: Enable User Registration
registration.desc: When disabled, new users cannot sign up. Existing users can still log in.

users.title: User Management
users.desc: Manage existing users and their roles.

collections.title: Collections
collections.noCollections: You haven't created any collections yet.

workflows.title: Workflows
workflows.subtitle: Chain prompts together to create powerful automations.

empty.title: No workflows yet
empty.desc: Create your first prompt chain to automate complex tasks.

prompts.noResults: No prompts found matching your criteria.

placeholders.title: e.g. SEO Blog Post Generator
placeholders.description: Short description of what this prompt does...
placeholders.resultText: Paste the output of the prompt here...

hints.variables: Define the variables used in your prompt (e.g. {{topic}}).

errors.createFailed: Failed to create prompt. Please try again.
errors.createVersionFailed: Failed to create version. Please try again.

actions.confirmRestore: Are you sure you want to restore this version? This will create a new version with the same content.

placeholders.enterLargeText: Enter regular or large text here...

settings.title: Settings
settings.backupPathDesc: Absolute path to the folder where backups will be saved.
settings.backupNowDesc: Immediately download a full backup of your current library.
settings.cleanupTagsDesc: Remove all tags that are not currently used by any prompt.
settings.restoreDataDesc: Restore your database from the latest auto-backup found in your configured backup folder.
settings.warningOverwrite: Warning: This will overwrite current data.
settings.resetDatabaseDesc: Permanently delete all prompts, collections, and tags. This action cannot be undone.
settings.userVisibilityDesc: Check the users whose prompts you want to see in your dashboard.
settings.showTipsDesc: Display a helpful prompting tip on the dashboard each day.
settings.collectionVisibilityDesc: Uncheck collections you want to hide in your dashboard. Hidden collections (and their children) will not appear in the sidebar or main view.

importExport.title: Import / Export
importExport.aiScraperDesc: Learn how to use AI (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini) to scrape prompts from any website and import them here.
importExport.exportDesc: Download all your prompts as a JSON file. This includes all metadata and the latest version of each prompt.
importExport.importStandardDesc: Upload a JSON file exported from this application.
importExport.importPromptCatDesc: Import prompts from a PromptCat export file.
importExport.promptCatStep3: Click Export Data to download the JSON file.
importExport.importLocalDesc: Recursively import prompts from a folder on your server/computer hard drive. Subfolders will become Collections. Text/Markdown files will become Prompts.
importExport.absFolderDesc: The application must have read permissions for this folder.
importExport.targetCollectionDesc: Select a collection to import into. If "Root", a new root collection will be created with the folder name.
importExport.importing: Importing... this may take a while
importExport.exportZeroDesc: Select collections to export for the lightweight version.

help.title: Help Center
help.subtitle: Documentation v2.3
help.checkRepo: Check the GitHub repository for issues or feature requests.

changelog.desc: For older versions, please see the full changelog on GitHub.
changelog.li1: Export Collection: Added 'Export Collection' option to the specific collection menu, allowing users to export a collection tree as a JSON file.
changelog.li3: Documentation: Merged technical documentation (SAD merged into Technical Reference).
changelog.li4: Documentation: Fixed broken image paths in Technical Reference.
changelog.li6: Dashboard Favorites: Fixed a bug where the last favorite item could not be unfavorited.
changelog.li7: Prompt View: Fixed a UI bug where the description of a variable was displayed twice.
changelog.li8: Prompt Edit: Fixed an issue where the description field would get cleared when adding or removing tags.

intro.welcome: Welcome to PromptHive, your local-first sanctuary for managing, testing, and organizing LLM prompts.
intro.desc: Prompt engineering is an iterative process. Storing prompts in text files or chat histories leads to version chaos. PromptHive solves this by treating prompts like code—with version control, variables, and structured organization.
intro.organizeDesc: Infinite nested collections and tags keep your library clean.
intro.versionDesc: Never lose a good prompt. Every save creates a new history entry.
intro.templatizeDesc: Use variables like {{topic}} to create reusable templates.
intro.tipsDesc: Get daily Prompting Tips on your dashboard to improve your skills (can be disabled in Settings).

gettingStarted.tip: You don't need an internet connection. PromptHive runs entirely locally on your machine.
gettingStarted.step1Li2: Give it a clear title (e.g., "SEO Blog Post Generator").
gettingStarted.step1Li3: (Optional) Assign it to a Collection or add Tags.
gettingStarted.step1Li4: Write your prompt in the editor.
gettingStarted.step2Desc: Once created, you can "Run" a prompt manually to document its output.
gettingStarted.step2Li3: Paste the output from ChatGPT/Claude into the "Result Text" field.

variables.desc: Variables make your prompts dynamic. Instead of rewriting "Write a blog about Dogs", you can write "Write a blog about {{topic}}" or [[topic]].
variables.goodEx1: Act as a {{role}} expert.
variables.bad: // Bad (Spaces inside braces are okay, but keep it simple)
variables.autoDetectDesc: When you type {{variable}} in the editor, click the "Auto Add Variables" button. The app will automatically scan your text and create form fields for them!

collections.desc: PromptHive uses a recursive folder structure. This means:
collections.li3: There is no limit to the depth of nesting.
collections.dragDropDesc: You can drag collections in the sidebar to reorganize them. Drop a collection onto another to make it a child. Drop it onto the "Collections" header to make it a root folder.
collections.sortingDesc: You can sort prompts within a collection by Name or Date using the controls in the list header.
collections.collapseDesc: You can collapse the Collections and Tags sections in the sidebar to save vertical space.
collections.visibilityDesc: If you have collections you rarely use, you can hide them from the dashboard. Go to Settings > Collection Visibility and uncheck the collections you want to hide. They will remain in the database but won't clutter your view.

aiScraping.desc1: You can easily import prompts from any website (blogs, articles, etc.) by using an LLM like ChatGPT, Claude, or Gemini as a "middleman" scraper.
aiScraping.desc2: Simply copy the URL of the page you want to scrape, give it to the AI along with the System Instruction below, and then import the generated JSON file here.

commandPalette.desc: Navigate PromptHive efficiently without taking your hands off the keyboard using the global Command Palette.
commandPalette.li1: Navigate instantly to Home, Settings, or Help.

visualDiff.desc: Prompt engineering involves many small tweaks. PromptHive allows you to Visually Compare any two versions of a prompt to see exactly what changed.
visualDiff.li1: Navigate to a Prompt's detail page.
visualDiff.li2: Look at the Version History list on the right side.
visualDiff.li3: Click the Compare icon on any version row (except the one currently selected).
visualDiff.li4: A modal will appear showing the diff between the selected version and the clicked version.
visualDiff.greenDesc: Indicates text that was Added in the newer version.
visualDiff.redDesc: Indicates text that was Removed from the older version.
visualDiff.restoreDesc: You can restore any previous version to become the new current version. Click the 'Restore' icon (circular arrow) next to a version in the history list. This creates a new version copy, preserving your linear history.
visualDiff.tipDesc: Use this to verify if your latest "tweak" actually improved the prompt or just moved words around!

language.desc: PromptHive supports multiple languages. You can change your preferred language at any time.
language.li1: Navigate to the Settings page via the sidebar.
language.li3: Choose your language from the dropdown menu (e.g., English, Nederlands, Français).
language.tip: Your language preference is saved to your account and will persist across sessions.

userProfile.desc: Manage your identity and security settings directly from the application.
userProfile.accessDesc: Click your Avatar or Username at the bottom of the sidebar. This opens your Profile dialog where you can:
userProfile.li1: Update Avatar: Upload a custom profile picture (JPG/PNG).
userProfile.li2: Change Password: Update your login credentials securely.
userProfile.forgotDesc: If you are locked out, use the Forgot Password link on the login screen. You can request a reset link to be sent to your registered email address.

exporting.desc: PromptHive offers multiple ways to get your data out:
exporting.markdownDesc: On any prompt detail page, click the button to download a formatted .md file. This file includes the prompt version, variables, metadata, and references to attachments.
exporting.jsonDesc: Navigate to Import / Export in the sidebar to download your entire library as a JSON file. This export now preserves your complete Collection Hierarchy and structure.

locking.desc: Protect your work from accidental edits by Locking your prompts.
locking.li2: Click the Unlock icon in the header.
locking.li3: The icon will change to a Closed Padlock, indicating the prompt is locked.
locking.effectDesc: When locked, the Edit, Save New Version, and Add Variable buttons are disabled for everyone (except you). Use this to mark prompts as 'Final/Stable' or to prevent team members from modifying your templates.

admin.desc: Administrators have access to special controls to manage the instance and its users.
admin.usersDesc: In the Settings > Admin panel, you can view all registered users. You can toggle their roles (User/Admin) or view their details.
admin.registrationDesc: You can Disable Registration globally. This is useful if you want to close your instance to the public after setting up your team.
admin.visibilityDesc: Admins (and users) can choose to Hide content from specific users in their dashboard to reduce clutter.

faq.q1: Q: Where is my data stored?
faq.a1: Everything is stored in a local SQLite database (`dev.db`) in your project folder. Images are stored in `public/uploads`.
faq.q2: Q: What happens if I delete a parent collection?
faq.a2: You have two choices: Delete Everything (which wipes all children and prompts inside) or Delete Collection Only (which moves all children/prompts up to the parent level or Root).
